qas.question: What contagiously throbs during the week of events?
How long does Aruba's biggest celebration last?
What type of costumes play a central role in the Queen elections?
What continues in various districts throughout the month of the Carnival?
When is King Mom symbolically burnt?

context: Carnival means weeks of events that bring colourfully decorated floats, contagiously throbbing <a0_0>music<a0_0/>, luxuriously costumed groups of celebrants of all ages, King and Queen elections, electrifying jump-ups and torchlight parades, the Jouvert morning: the Children's Parades and finally the Grand Parade. Aruba's biggest celebration is <a1_0>a month<a1_0/>-long affair consisting of festive "jump-ups" (street parades), spectacular parades and creative contests. Music and <a2_0>flamboyant<a2_0/> costumes play a central role, from the Queen elections to the Grand Parade. <a3_0>Street parades<a3_0/> continue in various districts throughout the month, with brass band, steel drum and roadmarch tunes. <a4_0>On the evening before Lent<a4_0/>, Carnival ends with the symbolic burning of King Momo.
